016package edu.cnm.deepdive.teamle.controller;
017
018import android.content.Context;
019import android.os.Bundle;
020import android.text.Editable;
021import android.text.TextWatcher;
022import android.view.LayoutInflater;
023import android.view.View;
024import android.view.ViewGroup;
025import androidx.annotation.ColorInt;
026import androidx.annotation.NonNull;
027import androidx.annotation.Nullable;
028import androidx.fragment.app.Fragment;
029import androidx.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner;
030import androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelProvider;
031import com.google.android.gms.auth.api.signin.GoogleSignInAccount;
032import dagger.hilt.android.AndroidEntryPoint;
033import edu.cnm.deepdive.teamle.R;
034import edu.cnm.deepdive.teamle.databinding.FragmentDemoBinding;
035import edu.cnm.deepdive.teamle.model.entity.User;
036import edu.cnm.deepdive.teamle.viewmodel.LoginViewModel;
037import edu.cnm.deepdive.teamle.viewmodel.PermissionsViewModel;
038import edu.cnm.deepdive.teamle.viewmodel.PreferencesViewModel;
039import edu.cnm.deepdive.teamle.viewmodel.UserViewModel;
040import java.util.Objects;
041import java.util.Set;
042import java.util.regex.Matcher;
043import java.util.regex.Pattern;
044import java.util.stream.Collectors;
045
046/**
047 * Demonstrates access to and observation of {@link androidx.lifecycle.LiveData} elements in
048 * {@link LoginViewModel}, {@link UserViewModel}, {@link PermissionsViewModel}, and
049 * {@link PreferencesViewModel}, as well as acting as a navigation placeholder. This fragment can be
050 * used as an example for creating other navigable fragments that access these core viewmodels; it
051 * can then be evolved to provide more application-specific utility, or removed/replaced
052 * altogether.
053 */
054@AndroidEntryPoint
055public class DemoFragment extends Fragment {
056
057  private static final Pattern PERMISSION_NAME_PATTERN = Pattern.compile("(?<=\\.)[^.]*$");
058
059  private FragmentDemoBinding binding;
060  private UserViewModel userViewModel;
061  private User user;
062  @ColorInt
063  private int saveColor;
064  @ColorInt
065  private int cancelColor;
066  @ColorInt
067  private int disabledColor;
068
069  @Nullable
070  @Override
071  public View onCreateView(@NonNull LayoutInflater inflater, @Nullable ViewGroup container,
072      @Nullable Bundle savedInstanceState) {
073    Context context = getContext();
074    //noinspection DataFlowIssue
075    loadColors(context);
076    binding = FragmentDemoBinding.inflate(inflater, container, false);
077    setupUI();
078    return binding.getRoot();
079  }
080
081  @Override
082  public void onViewCreated(@NonNull View view, @Nullable Bundle savedInstanceState) {
083    super.onViewCreated(view, savedInstanceState);
084    ViewModelProvider provider = new ViewModelProvider(requireActivity());
085    LifecycleOwner owner = getViewLifecycleOwner();
086    setupLoginViewModel(provider, owner);
087    setupUserViewModel(provider, owner);
088    setupPermissionsViewModel(provider, owner);
089    setupPreferencesViewModel(provider, owner);
090  }
091
092  @Override
093  public void onDestroyView() {
094    binding = null;
095    super.onDestroyView();
096  }
097
098  private void loadColors(Context context) {
099    saveColor = context.getColor(R.color.save);
100    cancelColor = context.getColor(R.color.cancel);
101    disabledColor = context.getColor(R.color.disabled);
102  }
103
104  private void setupUI() {
105    binding.localDisplayName.addTextChangedListener(new DisplayNameWatcher());
106    binding.save.setOnClickListener((v) -> saveChanges());
107    binding.cancel.setOnClickListener((v) -> cancelChanges());
108  }
109
110  private void setupLoginViewModel(ViewModelProvider provider, LifecycleOwner owner) {
111    provider
112        .get(LoginViewModel.class)
113        .getAccount()
114        .observe(owner, this::handleAccount);
115  }
116
117  private void setupUserViewModel(ViewModelProvider provider, LifecycleOwner owner) {
118    userViewModel = provider.get(UserViewModel.class);
119    userViewModel
120        .getCurrentUser()
121        .observe(owner, this::handleUser);
122  }
123
124  private void setupPermissionsViewModel(ViewModelProvider provider, LifecycleOwner owner) {
125    provider
126        .get(PermissionsViewModel.class)
127        .getPermissions()
128        .observe(owner, this::handlePermissions);
129  }
130
131  private void setupPreferencesViewModel(ViewModelProvider provider, LifecycleOwner owner) {
132    provider
133        .get(PreferencesViewModel.class)
134        .getSelectableTextPreference()
135        .observe(owner, this::handleSelectableTextPreference);
136  }
137
138  private void handleAccount(GoogleSignInAccount account) {
139    if (account != null) {
140      binding.googleDisplayName.setText(account.getDisplayName());
141      if (account.getIdToken() != null && !account.getIdToken().isEmpty()) {
142        binding.bearerToken.setText(account.getIdToken());
143        binding.bearerTokenLayout.setVisibility(View.VISIBLE);
144      } else {
145        binding.bearerTokenLayout.setVisibility(View.GONE);
146      }
147    }
148  }
149
150  private void handleUser(User user) {
151    this.user = user;
152    binding.localDisplayName.setText(user.getDisplayName());
153    checkSaveConditions();
154  }
155
156  private void handlePermissions(Set<String> permissions) {
157    binding.permissions.setText(
158        permissions
159            .stream()
160            .map(PERMISSION_NAME_PATTERN::matcher)
161            .filter(Matcher::find)
162            .map(Matcher::group)
163            .collect(Collectors.joining(", "))
164    );
165  }
166
167  private void handleSelectableTextPreference(Boolean selectable) {
168    if (selectable) {
169      binding.googleDisplayName.setEnabled(true);
170      binding.googleDisplayName.setTextIsSelectable(true);
171      binding.bearerToken.setEnabled(true);
172      binding.googleDisplayName.setTextIsSelectable(true);
173      binding.permissions.setEnabled(true);
174      binding.permissions.setTextIsSelectable(true);
175    } else {
176      binding.googleDisplayName.setEnabled(false);
177      binding.googleDisplayName.setTextIsSelectable(false);
178      binding.bearerToken.setEnabled(false);
179      binding.googleDisplayName.setTextIsSelectable(false);
180      binding.permissions.setEnabled(false);
181      binding.permissions.setTextIsSelectable(false);
182    }
183  }
184
185  private void checkSaveConditions() {
186    String input = Objects.requireNonNull(binding.localDisplayName.getText())
187        .toString()
188        .trim();
189    if (user != null
190        && !input.isEmpty()
191        && !input.equals(user.getDisplayName())
192    ) {
193      binding.save.setColorFilter(saveColor);
194      binding.save.setEnabled(true);
195      binding.cancel.setColorFilter(cancelColor);
196      binding.cancel.setEnabled(true);
197    } else {
198      binding.save.setColorFilter(disabledColor);
199      binding.save.setEnabled(false);
200      binding.cancel.setColorFilter(disabledColor);
201      binding.cancel.setEnabled(false);
202    }
203  }
204
205  private void saveChanges() {
206    user.setDisplayName(
207        Objects.requireNonNull(binding.localDisplayName.getText()).toString().trim());
208    userViewModel.save(user);
209  }
210
211  private void cancelChanges() {
212    binding.localDisplayName.setText(user.getDisplayName());
213  }
214
215  private class DisplayNameWatcher implements TextWatcher {
216
217    @Override
218    public void beforeTextChanged(CharSequence charSequence, int start, int count, int after) {
219      // Intentionally left empty; no action required.
220    }
221
222    @Override
223    public void onTextChanged(CharSequence charSequence, int start, int before, int count) {
224      // Intentionally left empty; no action required.
225    }
226
227    @Override
228    public void afterTextChanged(Editable editable) {
229      checkSaveConditions();
230    }
231
232  }
233
234}
